Class DrawingObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • DrawingObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DrawingEllipse, DrawingLine, DrawingSquare, DrawingX

    public abstract class DrawingObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Eric Sekyere
    This abstract class defines the four functions that all of the DrawingObject derived classes must have. The four abstract functions defined in this class must be implemented in the classes that extend this one.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DrawingObject() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean clickHitEllipse(int px, int py, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      This utility function makes it easy to check whether the coordinates of the user's mouse click (px,py) are on (or very close to) the ellipse defined by the bounding box with corners at (x1,y1) and (x2,y2).
      static boolean clickHitLine(int px, int py, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      This utility function makes it easy to check whether the coordinates of the user's mouse click (px,py) are on (or very close to) the line between the two points, (x1,y1) and (x2,y2).
      abstract void drawObject(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
      This function is called to request that the object draw itself using the provided Graphics2D context.
      abstract java.awt.Rectangle getBoundingBox()
      This function returns a Rectangle object that describes the 'bounding box'.
      abstract void resizeObject(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      This function changes the coordinates that define the location and size of the object.
      abstract boolean wasClicked(int px, int py)
      This function returns a boolean that indicates whether the provided coordinate (px,py) hits any part of the object.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • resizeObject

        public abstract void resizeObject(int x1,
                                  int y1,
                                  int x2,
                                  int y2)
        This function changes the coordinates that define the location and size of the object.
        Parameters:
        x1 - x point for initial coordinate
        y1 - y point for initial coordinate
        x2 - x point for final coordinate
        y2 - y point for final coordinate

      • wasClicked

        public abstract boolean wasClicked(int px,
                                   int py)
        This function returns a boolean that indicates whether the provided coordinate (px,py) hits any part of the object.
        Parameters:
        px - x coordinate of provided point
        py - y coordinate of provided point
        Returns:
        true if provided coordinate hits any part of the object else false

      • getBoundingBox

        public abstract java.awt.Rectangle getBoundingBox()
        This function returns a Rectangle object that describes the 'bounding box'. The bounding box is the smallest rectange that contains the object.
        Returns:
        a rectangle object as a bounding box

      • drawObject

        public abstract void drawObject(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        This function is called to request that the object draw itself using the provided Graphics2D context.
        Parameters:
        g2 - A graphics2D object

      • clickHitLine

        public static boolean clickHitLine(int px,
                                   int py,
                                   int x1,
                                   int y1,
                                   int x2,
                                   int y2)
        This utility function makes it easy to check whether the coordinates of the user's mouse click (px,py) are on (or very close to) the line between the two points, (x1,y1) and (x2,y2).
        Parameters:
        px - x coordinate of mouse click
        py - y coordinate of mouse click
        x1 - x point of the first coordinate of object to check for mouse click proximity
        y1 - y point of the first coordinate of object to check for mouse click proximity
        x2 - x point of the second coordinate of object to check for mouse click proximity
        y2 - y point of the second coordinate of object to check for mouse click proximity
        Returns:
        true if the point where the user clicked is on or close to the line between the two points,(x1,y1) and (x2,y2)

      • clickHitEllipse

        public static boolean clickHitEllipse(int px,
                                      int py,
                                      int x1,
                                      int y1,
                                      int x2,
                                      int y2)
        This utility function makes it easy to check whether the coordinates of the user's mouse click (px,py) are on (or very close to) the ellipse defined by the bounding box with corners at (x1,y1) and (x2,y2).
        Parameters:
        px - x coordinate of mouse click
        py - y coordinate of mouse click
        x1 - x point of the first coordinate of object to check for mouse click proximity
        y1 - y point of the first coordinate of object to check for mouse click proximity
        x2 - x point of the second coordinate of object to check for mouse click proximity
        y2 - y point of the second coordinate of object to check for mouse click proximity
        Returns:
        true if the coordinates of the user's mouse click (px,py) are on close to the ellipse defined by the bounding box with corners at (x1,y1) and (x2,y2).
